description:
Years ago I went to a 360 in the East Bay for lunch A LOT, and it was great (bonus points for tofu). Did I change, did it, or were these two never the same? Maybe all of the above.

While the staff was friendly, service quick, and ingredients fresh, the burrito was so terribly bland. It was as if it were designed for someone allergic to flavor, which is especially surprising given the Thai burrito (which was my fav at the East Bay joint) was described as having "spicy" sauce. I kept thinking, maybe all the flavor fell to the bottom, I'll get there. Nope. 

Given there was nothing actually wrong with the ingredients, I'd give a different menu item a try, but I'd make sure to ask for whatever can actually impart flavor. Let's see what's in store for an updated review.
author: Cristina S.

description: I went to farmers market on 6/14 and went to this burrito place for lunch.  I saw free drink or chips on the front entry way.  I bought a burrito and a side of guacamole to go with free chips.  When paying I thought for certain the register/owner? would give the free chips he did not say anything so i said could i get the free chips.  he said, it is only before 11:30 and i said who eats chips for breakfast.  Than i said why is the sign out to capture customers. this seams like a bate & switch to me.  Than I said that I would never be returning.  He said, oh yes you will. I than replied I PROMISE to never return.  I would give zero star if possible.
author: David W.

description:
Came here for lunch today because I've been in dire need of a good breakfast burrito recently.  I left still in need of a good breakfast burrito.

The guy behind the cash register was fine.  Of course I didn't come here with a groupon or anything so there were no complications, just a cash transaction.

I ordered the breakfast burrito with bacon. The bacon was scarce and barely cooked.  No crunchiness or texture to suggest it was any more than adequately cooked.  

The hot salsa (tomatillo and cilantro) was 1) not hot at all and 2) so liquidy that I felt like at the end I was consuming a burrito soup.  Aside from the salsa leaking out the entire time I ate the burrito, the bottom of the burrito was soggy by the time I got there (and I'm a fast eater).  

I will continue my hunt for a good breakfast burrito elsewhere.
author: Nick D.

description: Manager is slimey. Upon entering I noticed that they had a promotion to where if you bought anything on the menu over seven dollars you got a free chipper drink (before 11:30am). After purchasing a $10 burrito I waited for the owner to let me know that I was eligible for the promo. I asked him multiple times if there was anything else he wanted to mention before I left. He said no. Hoping I didn't  request the promo, he pretended to be oblivious and it wasn't until I called him out that he replied.   As a new customer I will not be returning because this is really unethical. I gave you multiple chances to be a decent human and offer me the promo. You failed the character test.
author: Erik C.

description:
It's an average burrito shop. I would have given a higher star rating if the employees were a little friendly.
Anyways just grab your lunch  and go. The burritos are alright and the bowls are definitely good but the service just makes the experience hollow.
author: Urvish -.

description: Yummy with healthy options! I ordered the veggie burrito bowl which includes tofu, broccoli and mushrooms. The ingredients tasted pretty fresh and the flavors came together pretty nicely without it being overpowering (sorry Chipotle, but sometimes you overdo it). Portion's were also pretty filling because I only ate about half before saving the rest for later. The interior is pretty small, so I would recommend getting your order to go. Service was also quick and the people working here are friendly. My experience here wasn't as bad as some of the other reviewers were, but that could've been due to my particular order. Veggie burrito bowls FTW.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
The food at this place wasn't nearly as bad as most of the below reviews suggested, but I do echo the sentiment that the guy behind the register is not great - I had a expired Groupon, and he postured as though he didn't know the credit was still usable. -_-

Anyway, I had a garlic-lime chicken bowl, and it was great. But like many, I'd probably not return without some sort of deal.
author: Shendi X.

description:
We came here during work lunch for some burrito goodness. Unique to this particular restaurant is a range of toppings and options for a more worldly flavoured burrito. Feel like Indian? Thai? Teriyaki? They'll add the sauce and veggies in with the rice, beans and salsa. There's also the option for a burrito wrap or bowl.

Seating is limited inside the restaurant but there's lots of outside seating in the courtyard area. 

Ingredients were plentiful, fresh, and tasty. My bowl was filled and there was definitely a lot of food available, I couldn't finish everything I had in front of me. Service through the restaurant itself was quick and pleasant. 

This is a good option nearby if you want to avoid the larger chain burrito restaurants!
author: Cassandra J.

description:
Don't get their burritos.  

Do get their tacos.

Then, drizzle it with the salsas that they provide in the barrel on the side.

With that being said, their tacos are good to grab for lunch if you are in Financial District, stuck at work in that area and craving for some tacos.

This place is simply set up for convenience.

I wouldn't even bother looking at the burrito selections on the menu.

Ciao for now.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
My bud Jeremy P bought a Groupon so we went back and shared some Chicken Nachos and he got a burrito. Not only were wer overcharged for the nachos, but they made me feel physically sick after.

The burrito he got was so-so, but he said he didn't want to come back, and I'm guna have to agree, it's just not worth it. Sad because I thought I was on to something back in November.
author: Crystal C.

description:
This place used to be a lunch time regular spot for me but I have since been unimpressed everytime I eat here for the following reasons:

A) They've stopped giving chips with meals
B)The pricing keeps changing. Sour cream and cheese are always varying in price and basically the prices on the menu don't mean much.
C)The cashier only gives 1 stamp no matter how many meals you purchase.
D) There is a 50% chance they get my order wrong on any given order.

They have, however revamped the counter so you can see the ingredients now
author: Mel P.

description:
I had a meeting around here so I stopped in early before lunch to bring back a burrito to work. I've tried their sister place at One Market once and had a nice wrap so I thought this would be good. Couldn't have been more wrong.

Well, this was the most DISGUSTING burrito I have ever encountered. I asked for their 360 Burrito with STEAK and guacamole. I received a giant burrito filled with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, some horrible russian-dressing-like-sauce and big chunks of CHICKEN. To be fair, there were about four pieces of beef in there, but calling it steak is a huge stretch. It was awful. There was no guac. And, it was priced OVER $10.
author: REN S.

description: Don't come to this restaurant. Owner is a jerk. Unfriendly and terrible people manager. When asked about the code for restroom, he pretended not to know. Good thing Nearby restaurant gave the code.   I'm on business travel and just happened to stop by Crocker Galleria. This must be San Francisco a good example of a liberal city.
author: Edmund E.

description:
OKAY burritos, not horrible.. but not authentic and definitely overpriced as you'd expect a burrito place in the FIDI/Crocker Galleria would be.

I'm a bit torn about this place. I would give this place a 3 if it wasn't as expensive.

But I do like the fact that they substitute brown rice for free and even offer quinoa for $1.50. + Vegetarian and some fusion options.. fine.
The burritos start at $6.75 or so but does NOT include cheese or guacamole.. so after making it 'super' and adding tax, it comes out to about $10 for a whatever burrito.
Like some others have said it also is kind of watery (I think b/c they put lettuce in the burrito). AAAAAAAAND I'm not sure if it's the burrito's fault but I did slightly get the runs the same day I ate this.

I don't think I'd return, I'll rather go to Tlaloc and pay almost the same price OR go to a taco truck and pay less for something more delicious and fresh.
If you DON'T like cheese/guacamole in your burrito then it makes for a decent priced lunch. It also makes you a weirdo in my eyes!
author: Emily C.

description:
I decided to try the fish tacos and I'm sorry I did.   When I got the plate back to work I couldn't wait to dig in.  The tacos were drowned in lots of cheese and sour cream and after taking a bite I realized why.  

First there was hardly any fish under all that and the few pieces I ate were bland.   And the food was so oily that when I tried to lift one of the tacos to share with a coworker it fell apart!   

Just go up the street to Chipotle next time you're in need of a taco/burrito fix.   Or go another couple blocks down on Kearny to El Faro.
author: Liza C.

description:
Me and a coworker split a groupon which gave us burritos at $6.50 each. I got the shrimp burrito and I was actually pretty satisfied with my meal. I think if I paid standard prices, it wouldn't have been worth the trip.  

The place makes chipotle style burritos but with some alternative proteins such as lobster and shrimp. Given the awful reviews I was expecting something much worse than I received. The shrimp burrito had a decent amount of shrimp and was cooked right.

They skimped me a bit on tortilla chips so that was lame.  They had a few salsas, their verde was good but one of their hot salsas tasted very much like siracha with some other things mixed in. That's not salsa. Overall, 3 stars is about right if you use the groupon.
author: Huy V.

description:
Just don't go here.
You want tasty beans, rice, mexican food in general? Don't go here.

Honestly, Del Taco is down the street and probably has better tasting food than this place. 

So that pretty much sums it up.
author: Carina M.

description:
I ordered the spinach salmon salad. I didn't get spinach and by the time i got back to my office 2 blocks away what I did get was wilted lettuce and a bunch of zucchini with tiny pieces of salmon. 

My office mates got burritos and they seemed happy. 

Gave this place 2 stars since everyone else looked happy and nobody got sick.
author: Mariana M.

description: I work across the street from this place and am obsessed with their "mixed vegetable" burrito. The vegetables are sauteed in an amazing spicy garlic sauce that really makes their vegetarian burrito the best in the City!
author: Taryn E.

description:
There are better options around here. The beef and chicken are pretty good, but all comes together kinda poorly. I think their tomato salsa makes things kinda messy and not that great. 

They have a choice of wraps, whole wheat and spinach. That's a nice touch.

But when it comes down to it, 360 feels like a burrito place in a random mall somewhere else in America. Not downtown SF. I even prefer chipotle than this place.
author: Augusto M.

description: The location is ideal in the Crocker Galleria a beautiful mall of sorts. The menu is straightforward and the personnel helpful if you have any questions. I always go with the super steak burrito to see the kind of ingredients and establishment uses. Happy to report 360 Gourmet Burritos uses high quality ingredients. Also I got a good portion of meat without requesting extra steak. The order got to me quickly even though it was lunch time and they had a line. The sauces are already in the cups,so grab a couple and enjoy the burrito. Also they have good seating inside and right outside in the mall
author: Jimmy L.

description: I have only been here just this morning to get the veggie burrito (add meat for extra $$) that they have advertised on their standup sign.  IT WAS DELICIOUS, and almost too much food. My coworker kept saying how good it smelled.  Anyway please check out the breakfast burrito for $3.95 so they'll keep offering it.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Nearly unedible. 

Steak and prawn buritto bowl with no beans: the rice was soggy and tasteless, the steak was unflavored, the shirmp was undercooked, the whole dish was really liquidy, and there were beans when the the orderer said "no beans" to the cook right as he began to make it. 

I will say the mild red sauce in the to-go cups was good. It allowed me to dip the gross steaks in so I could at least meet my caloric needs for lunch. 

A few years ago I remember this place being really good with true chefs.

*** UPDATE***
It's now 2 hours since I ate that gross steak and prawn bowl and I got SICK. My stomach was first bloated for over an hour and spare the details...

Btw, I cooked the last 5 meals I ate and I have a tough as nails stomach.

This place needs to shut down.
author: Lily H.

description:
Had a burrito here for lunch.  YERGH.  Awful.  How can you mess up a burrito so bad?

Seriously.. what a joke.

Biggest waste of $8 I think I've spent in a while.
author: Yan L.

description: Stake and prawn burrito was amazing. I wished it was wrapped better. Fresh ingredients and tender meat.
author: Ruby P.

description:
Got the prawn salad because I am trying to be good today...

It's pretty decent! Not the best ever, but I only paid $6.50 so I'm happy with it. Would definitely like to get a burrito next time since it is, after all, a burrito place.

Maybe next time!
author: Alexandra W.

description:
My husband and I found this place on our last day in SF while we still had some time to kill before heading down to the airport to catch our flight home. Craving burritos and walking through the Crocker Galleria with our luggage, we spotted this place on the very top floor of the mini mall.

I ordered the special of the day: "chipotle prawn burrito" which was decent in taste and large in size. This burrito was STUFFED with all sorts of goodies. Unfortunately the prawns were all at the bottom of the burrito and the guacamole was all at the top depriving me of combining two flavours that I felt really needed to be together. The guacamole was subtle, a little bland and felt like it was missing something salty and the prawn was spicy and salty and needed something mellow to balance out the flavours. I eventually got a fork and opened up the burrito so I can experience all the contents at once versus in separate layers. It was a very messy lunch/dinner but decent in taste.

Overall, the service was okay and the food was comparable to any other fast food burrito joint at your local mall. Nothing spectacular about this place but I didn't find it horrible. Sometimes mediocrity is sufficient when you are hungry.
author: Kat M.

description:
*bangs head on desk*
As much sawdust as it was 7 years ago...and it's not even the same location.

Flavors = falls apart.  

Quality = meh.

Presentation = nice.

Service = friendly.

Prices = meh.

Overall....bored and dissatisfied.
author: Fannie S.

description: Fantastic burritos this is one of my go to places when I'm working in the city. Plus the stamp card is awesome too. The worker are nice and the salsa is Great. I highly recommend the veggie burrito and a Mexican coke . Very very good.  Five stars
author: Samantha A.

description:
Went here with my boyfriend when we were trying to kill time before our movie, so we decided to wander in the Galleria plaza shopping center. We decided to go to this restaurant because we thought it would be good and that burritos can never go wrong. 
I ordered a cajun chicken burrito I thought the sauce went well with the mexican rice, beans, salsa and bell peppers however for an even better taste just add some of their hot sauce and it tastes even better. I guess it is because the cajun seasoning wasn't brought out as much as their hot sauce. Even though, I thought the burrito is good, the downside is I don't really like burritos with fresh salad in them because it makes me feel like I'm eating a burger. I like burritos that have their salad mixed well with their salsa so the salad is slightly drenched but not heavily.
author: Victoria G.

description:
Here's the major problem that I find with burritos here:  too much sauce.

I've gotten burritos twice here and both were drenched in sauce that made the tortilla soggy.  Both times, I could see the sauce on the outside of the aluminum foil before I even started eating.  My paper bag was completely wet on the bottom.These workers are messy.  No, I don't want to touch sticky sauce while I eat.

And it's not just the messiness on the outside, it's the messiness on the inside.  Once you get about two-thirds through the burrito, you reach what I can only explain as a 'stew' of liquid and ingredients loosely held by a soggy, ready-to-break tortilla.

Once I got near the end, I couldn't do it anymore.  It was a pool of liquid garbage at the bottom of tin foil, with the bottom leaking slowly out onto my desk, because they can't wrap a burrito right.  I didn't want to stick my mouth in that mess or I would for sure have nasty burrito juices all over my face.  

Usually I would just forget about poor burrito-eating experiences, but this stuff got on my desk and stunk up the room.  No no no no.

Do employees even eat these burritos?  I doubt it.  They probably create something better for themselves.  Please cut the amount of sauce you put in so I don't get a pool at the bottom!  Seriously, employees, please simulate the experience of a customer.  Order a to-go burrito yourself, walk around for 5-10 minutes holding it up in a paper bag and then eat it.  You'll see why my experience (and others) here sucks.
author: Jon K.

description:
Nothing really special, nothing offensive.  Why do i still have this as one of the places I get burritos in FiDi?

$5 lunch special burrito.  It is not that thick, big, or meaty. *that's what she said* 

But it is perfect light lunch burrito size.  It comes in either whole wheat or regular tortilla varieties.  It comes with all the toppings: fresh romaine lettuce, grilled chicken breast (not very remarkable but edible), guacamole, sour cream, cheese, salsa, black or pinto beans.  It is not dripping in grease and the flavors and textures are satisfyingly standard.  

The reduced size means I don't feel bad downing the whole thing *that's what she said.*

Complaint that the burritos tend to be kind of poorly constructed.  Be prepared for beans and rice to be falling out and getting your guac all on one half of the burrito.  

But for $5 in FiDi for a craving-satisfying-burrito, I'd definitely say "A-ok."
author: Susan C.

description:
I was just straight up denied service for being a vegetarian. 

I went to 360 once before and tried to order the taco bowl with no meat in it. It turned into a five minute long conversation with the employee behind the counter sounding totally confused about why on earth anyone would want that. I asked her to just put more beans and cheese and salsa in it instead. I ended up paying the same price as i would have with meat, without getting more of anything. it was a half empty container, while my coworker got hers and it was full with meat. I felt a little cheated and let it go. 

Today, however, I went in and tried to get a $1.99 taco to supplement my lunch, and asked for it with no meat, because I'm a vegetarian. This is what our conversation looked like:

"Hi, is there any way that I can just get the single taco with beans instead of chicken or steak?"

"Do you want chicken or steak?"

"I don't want either, actually. Do you think that maybe you could just put on some beans instead?"

"We don't do that here." 

"Uhmmm... Really? You can't just reach over and grab some beans while you are making them and substitute it for some chicken or steak?"

"No. We don't do that here."

"So what do vegetarians do?"

"We have a vegetarian burrito  with roasted zucchini and squash"

(This is something completely different than what I was trying to order and is much more expensive)

"I don't want that though. I just want the taco. You really can't just put beans in it instead of meat?"

**He gives me a dirty look, and then rings me up for something that is 4 dollars**

"Four Dollars?! The taco is only two dollars! Why would I be charged 4 dollars to get beans in it? Beans cost less than meat!"

**He looks at me angrily and then deletes it from the register**

"We don't do that here."

"You really can't just put beans on it instead of meat?"

"No."

"Are you crazy?!"

**He looks stand offish and just shrugs.**

That's when I walked out. It was either eat meat, order something entirely different, or leave. 

It would have been one thing if it was premade. It would have been one thing if I was ordering something crazy and complicated. They basically just shunned me for no reason. They would have even saved on food costs if they had just assisted me. 

I am bewildered.

UPDATE - 

I just tried to email this review to the email address listed on thier website, and it was rejected. Apparently they hold customer care in very high regard.
author: Alex C.

description:
Zero stars. This location is absolutely HORRIBLE! Being a strict vegetarian, I ordered the tofu salad (which is supposed to be $1 cheaper than the chicken salad). They charged me for the chicken, saying there wasn't a "tofu" option on the menu. Then they joked with each other about chicken vs. tofu. Once I got my (huge) salad, I found pieces of chicken mixed in with my tofu. Not okay. Never coming back.

Oh and by the way, don't assume someone does not understand Spanish when you're talking about them and their vegetarian foods. It's awfully rude!
author: Andrea N.

description:
This is like fake Chipotle, except less delicious with less food. I got a burrito bowl. The chicken was dry. 

One plus: the plastic container it came in was really nice quality! I brought it home to bring lunch in. Which makes the $7+ I paid for my meal more reasonable.
author: Mina K.

description:
Wow, there are some pretty poor reviews of this place but I have gotten lunch here at least a dozen time over the past year or so and have found the food to be good and reasonably priced.  The two items I usually go for a the taco salad with chicken or the two taco meal deal.  Both cost less than $7 (which is hard to find in the FiDi!) and are reasonably filling and tasty.  

Not the most authentic Mexican food in the world, but if that is what you expected from a place that also offers a "Thai" burrito - it's your own fault, not the restaurant's :P  

Anyways, I think the food here is a great deal considering the location and have always be satisfied with my meal.
author: Liz H.

description: I give this place 5 stars for their curry chicken burrito. This burrito certainly makes it to the top 5 burritos in SF. Trust me when I say this and check it out for yourselves. BTW, this is one of those food establishments that is only open during the week since it's in the heart of the financial district in downtown sf.
author: Herman R.

description: Gourmet my butt!!!! Save your money and go to Chipotle if you want a burrito. This place is nasty and lacks taste and it's way overpriced.
author: Dusty N.

description:
"Q: how do you eat a burrito with goat cheese in it?  A: with an extended pinky "

Unlike most other Crocker establishments i actually think this one deserves almost 4 stars. Stopped by today and grabbed an item off the specials menu - vegie mix with goat cheese, which turned out to be totally tasty and seemed relatively healthy.
author: Oleg H.

description:
I work nextdoor so the galleria is the goto place for a quick lunch. My coworker hella likes this place. Ive been here twice, had the steak and lobster and the thai(?) burrito. Both have been ok, and i'll prolly be back here sometimes, but theres nothing too fabulous -_-. 

Good service, tomato/spinach/whole wheat wraps, and ok prices, but there are gooder values within the galleria~

My name is Boris Yelpsin, and I approve this message.
author: Daniel S.

description: Went here because of a Go Dish deal & got the chicken Cobb salad. It looked like a chain so I was surprised my chicken was pretty good and I didn't use the dressing. I dipped some salad in at the end just to try it and was glad I hadn't used it though! Not bad for a $6 lunch though.
author: Sophie B.

description:
The first time that I came here the burrito seemed bland.
But they have 5 different free homemade salsas and I was to blame for not taking enough of them to season and flavor it.  Add your own salsa and your own flavor.  I found the salsas to be simply wonderful, just tantalizing with fresh herbs, spices and bursting with flavor.  With 5 to choose from (and mixing multiple scoops into each cup) the combinations really require more time/visits to choose a favorite.
The extreme hot has just enough habanero to really be a noteworthy favorite.  I doubt that I will ever have too much of that.  Should really try the others more, I always try a different cup of one other plus the habanero sauce, but nothing else compares to the addictive habanero flavor.    

The salads have always been excellent.  

Things that seem pretty consistently mis-represented in other reviews:

1.  Price.  $10 for a burrito is NOT expensive.  I saw a bunch of people saying that was too much???  REALLY?  Compared to what?  By Yelp's price scoring that falls into the moderate price scale which is the determining factor in my frequent returns here.  Cannot get better food for less.  

2.  Authentic.  People complain that the food is not authentic.  This is NOT authentic at all.  It is gourmet.  It is better than authentic.  It is more diverse (with more options), more flavorful AND more healthy than authentic.  Remember: traditional Mexican food is based what the average Mexican living in Mexico can afford and has available.  I like to think of this place as what the wealthy might choose or have available as options.
It is unique and for that alone: I added a star because I have not experienced anything quite like it anywhere else.
In all of my extensive travel: I have never experienced anything like this anywhere else and that is a shame because Gourmet is definitely a step in the right direction.  
I LOVE traditional Mexican food.  But what is wrong with being better than authentic or traditional?  There is always room for improvement and Gourmet has definitely created something special.

3.  Ingredient quality is excellent.  The salsa aroma hits you from a few feet away, the veggies are crisp and fresh, the chicken, salmon and beef are well prepared.

4. Healthier fare.  This is healthier cooking than the authentic lard laden fare of the average authentic Mexican restaurant.  They have taken the best of both and really made a one of a kind fusion.  

This is a unique one of a kind flavor and mix.  Why would anyone want to make this authentic when there are countless hundreds of authentic places around in the first place?  The selections here are what authentic SHOULD be, not what it is.  Don't hate the innovator.  Unique is not for everyone, but this is healthy AND unique and that is a brilliant combination for my dollar.  
The closest thing that I could say is think of a Mediterranean Mexican fusion.  Or as I said before: upscale Mexican with the resources to import anything from anywhere in the globe.  Salmon is definitely not authentic Mexican, but who does not love salmon????  Want authentic?  Enjoy your snapper/rockfish and tilapia.  Me?  I like variety, I like unique.  I love authentic, but I also enjoy something fresh and new.  People who demand only authentic cannot indulge in any different flavor and for that alone I would ignore their opinion.  

That said: 4 stars says that I am a fan and that is true.  
If we were to take points by score I would deduct for the ceiling tiles over the kitchen needing replacement and the t-bar needing painting or replacement.  But aside from that my review pretty much stands at 4 stars.  If this place were near my home: it would be a regular stop.  
 Healthy, tasty food at a reasonable price is always going to win my loyalty.  I wish that we had one of these in Los Angeles.
author: Veronica S.

description:
This place is ok.

There are not many places that give you the chance to eat a non-Mexican burrito.  It seems like they just try to think of interesting things to put into burritos and sometimes they make something tasty.

If you are looking to try some different things in your burrito this might be for you.
author: Jade D.

description:
I've been here twice in the last 2 years and the first time was okay. Creative burritos with fancy tortillas. Nothing great. 

I just got their signature burrito (360 Degree Burrito) and came back to my desk to eat it. I got it super which is the only thing that's good in the burrito. All the meat if fatty and tough. I ended up picking it all out and eating it like a vegi burrito. 

Oh and I have to go because the bottom just fell out and I have burrito all down the front of my shirt...
author: Scott B.

description:
Ordered the steak/prawn burrito with extra sour cream and guacamole for $10.  Was convinced that this place would be a lot healthier than chipotle, but the steak in my burrito was tuff and was hard to chew.  

Will not be back.
author: Chanel L.

description: I tried the cajun steak whole wheat burrito today and it was very flavorful, a little spicy, vegetables were fresh, and just awesome! I like the fact that they give you the option of spinach, flour, wheat, etc. tortilla. I like the creative aspect to have cajun, thai, curry burritos -- quite interesting. I would definitely eat here and again and I recommend the cajun steak burrito! I'm excited to try the thai chicken burrito and their salads.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Why am I such a tool?!?!

I gave this place 3 stars last time I was here.   Why the fuck did I bother coming back?   Wasn't once bad enough?   Apparently not if you're a masochist who likes to eat shitty food just to torture yourself...

So I came back for lunch and this gourmet burrito of theirs sucked even worse than last time.   I had to unroll my burrito and throw away all the pieces of steak since these fucking things tasted like leather.

This better be the last time my stupid fucking brain drags me to this place...  It sucks.
author: David O.

description:
I went to the Crocker Galleria for some lunch since it was super cold outside. I walked around the top floor to see what kind of food was available. I decided to come here since I was craving some burritos. 

I honestly should have read the yelp reviews before I made my decision. The food here did not taste like anything as many people stated in their reviews. And, if it weren't for the salsa bar, I probably would have thrown that thing away. 

Maybe the more unique burritos taste better? But, I don't even want to try because what if those burritos are bland too? I don't think salsa can save a Thai influenced burrito. 

SKIP!!
author: Ayaka S.

description:
If i would have seen the reviews before going to the place i would have probably not gone. Tried the Cajun burrito with tofu, it was pretty good. I did read a few folks slam the veg options but considering that they actually have tofu as an choice is a good start. I am used to just beans, rice and cheese, so certainly a welcome option to add tofu. I would go back to try the other "World" options.

There was one goof up, we asked for sour cream (which you have to pay as add-on) but they forgot to incorporate it, The place was not that crowded and it was clearly on the receipt, we did swing by after we noticed the missing sour cream and they gave it us on the side but they certainly need to run a tighter ship if they want people returning.
author: Dinesh R.

description:
I love that 360 has tofu and many vegetarian options.   That statement alone will tell you it isn't authentic, especially in area without a lot of Mexican options, it is what it is. 

I love the $5.99 lunch deal--mini burrito, chips and salsa bar, and a soda.    That way I can enjoy some burrito action while not fighting the urge to crawl under my desk and nap the rest of the afternoon.   The chips are usually in a bag big enough to bring back and share with others. 

There are two things I don't like about this location.  They pump the KOIT too loud, so it is hard to talk with others in the restaurant.   The other is that salsas are prepacked in tiny containers.   I usually end up taking 5-6 spicy Thai sauce packets just for the chips.
author: Ellie Y.

description:
Sometimes it's OK, as in 3 stars.  Sometimes it's bad, as in 2 stars.  Averaging 2.5 stars, but minus half a star for inconsistency = 2 stars.  

I only eat here if I end up in the Galleria and can't decide to commit to anything else.  Why, oh why, can't I find a great burrito near my office?
author: Ted R.

description: Well 2.5 for the Curry, but 2.0 for the Thai burrito.  I came back to try the Thai, but it didn't taste any where near Thai.  It was "add some green peppers" and pretend it is Thai.  Where's the lemongrass flavor.  So sad.
author: Helen L.

description:
I already wrote a review for this... where is it?

I wanted a burrito and I got a wrap. I was a little bummed. It was pretty good, but it wasn't what I was looking for at all. I sort of wanted my co-workers chinese at this given moment.

Next time I'll try something else. "Signature burritos" or whatever marketing/signage they had to advertise their so-called "signature burrito" was slightly misleading.

Beans and rice in the future, with some messy cheese, please and thanks!
author: Kristin F.

description: I lost 30 lbs eating here!  I don't get burritos; I don't get tacos, I don't even get salads.  All I ever eat are the burrito bowls; prawns, chicken, lobster, scallops, whatever.  I always get the same ingredients: brown rice, quinoa, and a little bit of cheese.  If you go there enough times, the owner and the other guys who work there will remember you and what you like to order, which makes it kind of personable.  I like that.  I've lost a ton of weight trying to watch what I eat, and 360 makes it even easier when they make it so easy for you to customize your order, so that makes you feel less guilty about eating out!  I love coming here, and I want to make sure everyone gives them a chance!
author: Taryn B.

description:
Went here for lunch today.  I used my Crocker Galleria stamp card, so at least I didn't pay anything for this place.  The service was good and the food came out very quickly.  It just wasn't good.

Everything was bland.  I had the quesadilla with steak in it.  Nothing worth going back for.  It wasn't terrible, just had nothing special to offer.  Prices were good.
author: Brian G.

description: Disappointed with my quesadilla. Barely any cheese, no meat (this was not a vegetarian quesadilla), and translucent tomatoes.
author: Busy P.

description: First time here my food was good! The burrito bowl was very tasty with the sauces. The prices were decent and the worker was very polite and nice. Will come back again.
author: Matthew L.

description: I got tacos here since I needed a quick lunch. It wasn't very crowded but it still took a bit of time to take my order for some reason. I ordered 2 takes which came out to about $4 which I wasn't very disappointed about since I wasn't expecting anything special. The tacos came out and to be honest they're not what you would really expect out of a taco. They use really soft flour tortillas which do not seem very warm when you get your order. Maybe I'm too used to seeing cabbage in my tacos but here they use ice berg lettuce I think which was kind of odd. Anyways, they do put some kind of lime sauce which is pretty good and they are super generous in the amount of meat they put in the taco which kind of made up for the weird taco for me. The place itself is clean and there is self serve water but there is no salsa bar or anything so don't come in expecting a taqueria style Mexican place.
author: Jonathan T.

description:
Oh yummy!  Lots of veggies, a choice of low carb wraps, or no wrap.  The chicken is NOT shredded mystery meat, instead it's massive grilled white breast meat and the steak is high quality too.  I love that they put romaine lettuce in the burrito, so it's almost like a wrap, but with more of the BAD stuff!  You can make multiple meals out of one burrito and it's inexpensive.  Mmm!

I always came here for breakfast or lunch when I worked in the area, and when I'm at Oakland Int'l, this is my in-flight meal.
author: Cynthia C.

description: I was so excited when I found out there was a 360 in the Fi-Di! I used to work in San Ramon, and their 360 always had food with so much flavor! Always had lines out the door. 360 at Crocker is no where near in regards to consistency. When I get either the 360 quesadilla or burrito, sometimes it's darned good, other times the steak has been very gamey (ew!). Just not consistent enough to deserve a great review. On the flipside, they're pretty fast - and their garlic chili sauce is delicious, no matter what.
author: Jorge S.

description:
I've been here twice.  The 1st time I got a grilled vegetable and goat cheese wrap. Today, I got the Thai bowl with smoked tofu.  i actually enjoyed both my meals, and was rejoicing that the portion sizes are smaller than the gigantic amounts you get at other wrap places.  However, I then made the mistake of checking out the nutritional information.  Turns out my *bowl* has over 700 calories, 35+ grams of fat and over 2,000 mg of sodium.  Boo!  In retrospect, I probably should have known this but I deluded myself into thinking a "gourmet" burrito/wrap place in health-conscious San Francisco = healthy for your waistline. 

It's certainly a nice change from the mundane sandwich/salad spots in the FiDi.  But do yourself a favor and have coffee and a grapefruit for breakfast if you plan to indulge at lunch.

2.5 stars!
author: Rani V.

description:
The dreaded one star.  This place left no taste in my mouth except the fact that I needed to tell people earnestly to avoid this place.  I ended up here as a matter of convenience, our offices are half a block away.  But, I think Pace Picante salsa has more taste than this place will ever have.  That's right Pace!  

Either way, my mistake was that the "360 Degrees" label thwarted the logic that I would have come to naturally.  The words: gourmet & burrito should never be paired together.
author: Jonny G.

description: Ordered a Chicken Bowl Burrito.     Rice Sucks,   the burrito bowl was just that.   boring and un appetizing.    I will say the chicken was quite good.    lastly there Hot Sauce was going on!
author: Jerry P.

description:
Plenty to choose from here, and the staff is friendly.  Our favorites are the chicken and artichoke with brown rice, and a super burrito (usually chicken).  The chicken is all white meat so that's why we like it so much.  The quality of the steak is hit/miss.  The garlic/lime sauce is great, and you can get a burrito as a bowl and just dig in!! 

Almost all (if not all) the restaurants have a dining card/stamp program.  With 8 stamps you get $6 off your next meal.  You can mix and match so do it!  

Just beware of the pigeons that sometimes fly into the Galleria.  They're pesky!  LOL  But, on sunny days it's great to go the roof garden and eat outside.
author: Jake And Brittany S.

description:
Never go to this heretical 'burrito' joint! 

Since I currently work in the Financial District, the options for good food are pretty slim. I stupidly went to 360 Degrees 'Gourmet' Burritos at the Crocker Galleria and ordered their Thai Burrito. Yes, I was a Burrito Heretic; I committed a grave and mortal sin against the sanctity of San Francisco burritos. That aside, the Thai burrito itself wasn't particularly spectacular, and not worth the $7 they wanted for it. It was basically Thai peanut sauce, chicken, vegetables and jasmine rice -- not that good for a wrap or a 'burrito'. I've pretty much decided to just make my own lunches before I go to work because of the awful offerings downtown!
author: Finn G.

description: Pretty awful.  It seems like they are trying to imitate World Wrapps to some extent, except their food doesn't taste good.  I had their Thai Chicken, it was supposed to have peanut sauce - it had some sort of brownish sauce, but no flavor.
author: Robert D.

description: Tried the chicken teriyaki bowl and ended up throwing it all away.  Yuck.  Yeah, I know, what was I thinking when I ordered that at a burrito place?  I have never tried their burritos, but I hope they taste better than what I ate.
author: Christy L.

description:
The 5 is for the catering folks!

So there's only one thing that can accentuate any plate of food. If it's FREE. Shooooo....A free hotpocket tastes super gourmet'ish when I ake my brothers pay for it.

So Gourmet 360 offered HELLA good cusomter service, and the folks who dropped by to setup were really helpful. We ended with their "Make Ya Own Damn Taco" stand, which came with steak, chicken, beans, and the usual taco/burrito fixins.

The food was indeed HELLA good..but since I made it pratcially..I should get the 5 stars then huh? See? I knew those burrito rolling classes at State would make themselve handy one day!
author: Elijah W.

description:
When I am feeling particularly emotional, I do one of two things. I either

a) forego food altogether (which is when all of my reviews are of bars, pubs, and lounges and I revert back to my normal size 4) .

or

b) eat and eat and eat some more. Then lie about how much I'm eating. Then hide in a dark closet and eat some more before locking myself in my office and hiding under my desk and eating some more. (and all of my reviews are of pizzerias, taquerias, and chocolate shops and I blow up to some massive size and can't fit into any of my clothes).

Today's plan of attack was plan b, which may explain why I have just finished my second Burrito from this fine establishment and am working my way through bag-of-chips number 3. If I had enough money and wasn't so full that I can't walk, I would probably go back and order 360 more. Thank god the gym is close enough that someone can roll me down the street in a few hours and let me run like a rat on a wheel until I am so sweaty and exhausted that I cry and run simultaneously and no one will think I'm crazy.

Back to the burritos. They are not authentic Mission taqueria burritos but, HELLO! Have we met? I'm as Whitey McWhiterson as it gets and thus, these burritos are right up my gringatastic alley. Especially the Super Grilled Veggie Burrito with smoked tofu. Even when I'm in the throes of stuffing the pain away, I still avoid tortillas at all costs (don't like them) and the inside of this particular burrito is more than enough to satisfy a healthy appetite. 

My appetite is anything but healthy right now, but at least these burritos probably won't clog my arteries and send me to an early death. Even during the lunch rush, it isn't that busy. Plus it's far away enough from my office, that no one will catch me in there double ordering :)
author: Autumn K.

description:
Another Crocker Galleria staple in my lunch diet, the lamb burritos is one of my favorites. So it's not exactly an authentic Mission burrito, it is still a cut above some of the poor "authentic" Mexican options in the Fi-Di.

A burrito here serves as the shell for all sorts of cuisine, so for a chain, they do offer up some inventive offerings.
author: Nish N.

description: You could do worse when it comes to fast food, quality-wise, but they should really consider changing their name to 360-THOUSAND SPRIGS OF CILANTRO. I didn't realize one could overdose on an herb until it was not only prevalent throughout my rice and bean super burrito, but again in the otherwise yummy sweet & hot house sauce. And for the record -- I don't dislike cilantro. They're just far too liberal with such a strong ingredient.
author: Gregor G.

description:
Ewwwwwwwwwwww.

Who the fuck serves a taco without beans? And then when you ask for them you have to pay more and it's all doused with lime juice?

Crazy people that's who! I tried to give my leftovers to a bum and she refused them. Smart lady.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
Used to eat here regularly (as in, a LOT) when I was an investment banking analyst across the street.  Came here a few weeks ago for a little throw-back, turn-back-the-clock lunch celebrating the good old days (yes, the days when Lehman Brothers, Bear Stearns, and capitalism existed).

All I could think after my thro-back lunch:  WHAT IN BABYJESUS' HOLY NAME WAS I THINKING?

Why was I so misguided?  Was it because it was before my recent burrito rennaisance?  Was it the long nights as a banker, slaving away only stopping to worship the gods of powerpoint, excel, and VPs?  Or was it something else altogether...

Painfully bland, devoid of flavor burritos.  Worst of all, they're small.  The "Thai Chicken" is an embarrassingly defunct amalgamation of wannabe asian ingredients.  Trust me, there is nothing Gourmet about these burritos, especially for the price.

The fact that they use "Gourmet" in the name is a crime.  Clearly capitalizing on the busy Grocker Galleria crowd that is too busy to find solace in a legit alternative.  Several anagrams for Gourmet might prove fitting for our 360 degree burrito.  I offer these anagrams as alternative names for 360:  More Tug Burritos, Germ Out Burritos, More Gut Burritos, or my favorite:  Me Tug Or Burritos.
author: Nate H.

description: Offers a surprisingly tasty burrito in an area with a dearth of sumptuous (let alone authentic Mexican) offerings.
author: Miriam W.

description: The variety of burritos this place has it pretty impressive but thats where it stops . I decided to get the Thai burrito ...it sounded so much better than it was, the peanut sauce was very watered down and rice was just plain white no seasoning ...it did not remind me of Thai at all ...I prob won't be going back anytime soon
author: christina a.

description:
I went here for lunch recently boy do i regret it.  I tried their 360 Gourmet Burrito thinking that it can't go wrong because that's their specialty burrito!

I was very disappointed, the burrito was empty and filled with bland stuffing inside.  

The cashier even had the nerve to charge guac, salsa, and sour cream!  When you pay almost $7 bucks for a tiny burrito and to charge for the essential ingredients for a burrito -that's not cool.
author: Elliot Y.

description:
I know that I am no burrito expert but I think I can fare pretty well when it comes to how it tastes and the service of said burrito place.

I ordered my burrito.  I blinked.  They called my number.  I dumbly looked down at my receipt just to make sure it was my number.  It was.  I don't know about you folks but I have to say that is the FASTEST damn order I've ever received.  Three theories came to mind: 1.  Someone else must have left their order there and it just so happened to be the same thing I ordered.  I later disproved this theory by burning my tongue while chomping in to the burrito.  It was fresh as fresh could be.  2. I had a momentary lapse of consciousness.  Seriously.  I BLINKED and it was done.  BLINKED!!!  3.  I had been watching waaaaayy to much of Heroes and could now bend space and time....

So I'm chomping on it now and thoroughly enjoying it.  I read some other reviews before posting and people are complaining about the prices.  Welcome to the financial district. The Mission is only a short whatever-train-comes-first distance a way and you can get your cheap yet awesome Mexican food there. Also they were complaining about the portions. I don't know about you but my stomach can only hold so much food at a time and as for carrying left overs home.... well if you ride the N Judah imagine the wafting smell of a burrito 5 centimeters from your face mixed with the over-ripe smell of the homeless passengers that sometime ride with you all jam packed in to a tiny little train car and tell me you *still* want to eat it when you get home.

That's what I thought.

It's yummy, reasonably priced and I'm feeling a little adventurous since I saw their steak and lobster burrito.  Seriously.  Steak. Lobster. In a burrito.  I'm game!
author: Heather H.

description:
This is some of the most tasteless, overpriced Mexican food one can ever encounter in California.

I think if you reread that last sentence, focus on the words "tasteless" and "overpriced," you'll get a good idea about the four page scathing review I have in my mind that I don't have time to write. There is no redeeming quality in this food.
author: Andrew S.

description: Horrible. Not only are the burritos really unauthentic and nasty, but they messed up my order with the wrong meat, did NOT apologize and looked more flustered that I was complaining because they gave me chicken instead of prawns, and then charged me extra for sour cream, cheese, etc... Things that they did not tell me when I ordered. Never coming back even though I work across the street.
author: Amanda L.

description: I was recommended to eat here because of it's proximity to my job. I was looking for a quick bite and burrito was on my mind. I got a simple burrito. When I ate it I was puzzled since was not a typical burrito. I checked the burrito and saw lettuce in there. I thought that was it. They had a sense of humor and put lettuce in my burrito. I kept eating and noticed tomatoes. That was it. I had to check it out. It seemed a salad was wrapped with beans and rice. The chicken was a breast that was chopped to pieces with lettuce and tomatoes. The only normal thing was rice and beans. I have had too many burritos and this was very average. I thought and seems this is what a gourmet burrito is. A salad wrapped with rice and beans. The right sauce should make it great. As is I ate a salad in the name of a burrito. I will go back.
author: Cush D.

description:
This was another lunch that was too disgusting to actually finish eating. In fact, I had to immediately gorge myself on other food to cleanse my palette after tossing my steak teriyaki burrito.

Yes, a steak teriyaki burrito. I didn't come here expecting great food. I came here expecting so-bad-it's-good food (examples would be Baja Fresh, Panda Express, etc.) The idea of a steak teriyaki burrito excited me - rice, steak, onions, etc. wrapped up in a tortilla? Sounded good to me! 

Too bad it was inedible. The very first bite I took - and every subsequent bite - slammed me with sauce. SO. MUCH. TERIYAKI. SAUCE. And not even good teriyaki sauce. Everything was completely drenched, from the tortilla to each and every individual grain of rice. I felt like I was drinking teriyaki sauce that had bits and pieces of stuff in it. Does the description sound gross? Try eating it!

Umm...one star because they didn't put bell peppers in my burrito just like I asked.
author: Ada T.

description: I ordered the taco platter today and it was just so-so. I had so much lettuce in my taco and they serve the taco with one tortilla so the stuffing fell out before I could get it to my mouth. The salsas come into teeny tiny cups that even their teeny tiny chips can not make it into. I have had better. I will stick with Tropiseuno from now on.
author: Gina H.

description: Bland, but filling. I got a rice and beans burrito with salsa, guac, and cheese. Couldn't taste the guac, but I could see a slight green color in there somewhere, so I guess they didn't forget to put it on. The place was clean and the staff was nice though. If I ever return I'll just try something else.
author: Martina M.

description:
So I tried this place again, and while it's a good place to grab a decent burrito. It's not a four star burrito.
(I think I was just excited to find a new place to grab lunch.)

--------------------------

Fresh ingredients! How often do you get lettuce that is still crisp in a burrito?

So many fun burritos to try--Thai, BBQ, etc. A great, fresh take on the burrito.

And if it's a nice day, there is a roof patio.
author: Brad C.

description: This was just my first visit, but it was a total YUM. Steak and Prawn burrito very tasty, especially the meat and prawns. Beans were also good. A little too much rice.
author: Mom P.

description:
I love that 360 tries to be worldly and "gourmet."  The idea is a good one, but the execution leaves a little bit to be desired.  True, it's a good, standard lunch option, but I feel like the flavors lack that extra little *kick* that I'm looking for.

Nevertheless, I do like the beef and shrimp burrito...
author: Marcus C.

description:
Pretty good burritos.

However, I will never go back because of their deceptive pricing. All standard burritos (Mexican and world) are listed on the menu as $5.59. When I got my receipt, I had been charged $5.95. I went back to the counter to point it out, and the worker was completely unfazed, didn't apologize, denied that there was a discrepancy between the price advertised and the price charged. He said it was a tax. I pointed out that  there was an additional line item for tax. Even if it was the 3% healthcare tax on hot food, it would only have been raised to $5.76, not $5.95. Eventually the manager came over and threw a few dimes at me to make me leave without acknowledging that they had messed up.

A few dimes isn't a big deal in the broad scheme of things, but I won't patronize an establishment with bait-and-switch pricing.
author: Shannon L.

description: Run Away!  My burrito was already flavorless and all around sub-par, but then a fat cockroach crawled up the wall next to us.  It was hard to eat after that.
author: Jordan F.

description: My mission to find an epic salad for lunch failed when I realized the San Francisco Soup Company in the Crocker Galeria doesn't have an amazing salad bar like the one in the Bloomingdale's mall, so I walked next door to 360 Burritos. It was after the lunch rush so I had to wait 5 minutes for the entire experience to be over so I could walk back to my desk and devour the burrito and stink up my entire office. I got the curry burrito with smoked tofu and it was pretty good. Probably not worth the $7 price tag, but I was starvin' like Marvin and didn't care. Plus I don't even like burritos that are so gut bomb-y you can't even finish them. This one was simple, flavorful and healthy tasting, not greasy at all. I'm not in a food coma at my desk, and I don't feel like I need to eat carrot sticks for dinner. It's great. My brain still wants a salad though, damnit.
author: Laura M.

description:
Decent burrito - I'm always fooled thinking it will be cheaper. I usually get the super veggie. Not nearly as good as other places and just as much. I usually only come here because I'm in Crocker and want a burrito. 
Last time they had this kinda neon orange chipotle sauce that was actually quite tasty.

Technically qualifies for the under $5 club... If you got the regular veggie burrito it's only $4.50+tax. Super makes it, after tax, about $6.
author: Elsa E.

description:
When working downtown, 360 does the trick for a decent lunch.  Dismal burrito offerings in the Financial District (no, Lee's does NOT count) so 360 is consistent in its offerings.  

Not great but certainly not bad.

Try the cajun chicken...but throw it in a bowl.
author: Diego S.

description:
If you want a great fish taco and are near the Crocker Galleria Jump upstairs to the 3rd floor.  360 is the place to go!!! It has a lime garlic sauce with cilantro and a fresh mild fish without the breading.  It is light and tasty! Warning the flavors our addicting. :)
kris
author: kris g.

description: The burrito tasted a little too healthy for me, but I appreciated the unique ingredients (e.g. limes) you don't find in your typical burrito. Still, $9 is too much for a burrito.
author: Brian C.

description:
BREAKFAST BURRITO
who doesn't love those?
it comes with egg (you can get egg white only), salsa, cheese and sauce.
i get it with the following extras: potatoes, tomatoes, and avocados.
you gotta rhyme.  
its so good.  its the perfect cure for a hang over.   i am eating one right now.
I cant speak for the non-breakfast burritos...
author: Wakako U.

description:
This place has a lot of burrito options to choose from- chicken, steak, lobster, etc. The burrito's are huge so if you didn't bring a full appetite with you I suggest sharing one. The burritos come with these really tasty chips and home-made salsa. 
The establishment is listed as a "healthy option", which I believe they are as long as you only eat half a burrito instead of the full deal.
author: Janell D.

description:
Just tried this spot out for the first time today. I was hoping for a new go-to spot for lunch burritos after finding some good sized bones in my Pasilla burrito on Kearny. I know there are tons of other options in SF to grab a good burrito, but I was looking for a spot close to work.

I gave their 360 burrito a shot and it fell far short of expectation. The very first bite, I chewed into a marble sized piece of fat...and the second bite something cracked between my teeth. It was so loud, one of my co-workers got startled.

Taste wise it was ok. I think its one of those "fusion" type spots so you can't really expect much from them anyways. I'd say its a step down from chains like Rubio's, half step up from taco bell.

Maybe I'll give the all chicken a burrito next time and update my rating. Until then, I highly recommend NOT getting any type of carne asada from there.
author: wes w.

description:
I got a free lunch for signing up for some financial phone call!

-can't beat free :)
author: Danielle V.

description:
i'm surprised how much i like 360 burrito. It's a great burrito place and i love their gourmet burritos. The salmon & spinach is excellent! So is the steak & lobster. If you eat a lot this might not be the burrito place for you but for a small person like me i'm full after eating half. Even when I save the other half for dinner it's still really good. It doesn't get soggy at all.

I like the flavor a lot. The Salmon & Spinach is just so light that I won't feel guilty if I eat the whole thing for lunch.

Service is quick and friendly. It cost about $8-9 for a gourmet burrito. 360 might be the only place i'll go to for burritos now in the financial district.
author: Terry D.

description:
A meal that will last and last and last...

You have one meal here.  It remains in your stomach until the next time you come there to eat.  That can be a day later, a month later.  Since it is a burrito it will sit there forever.  The thing that works is that it is really tasty so if you want to taste a meal forever and ever and have half of it for later to also taste forever and ever, this will work for you.

www.burritobot.com if you would like to review the burritos there.
author: Gwen P.

description:
Their prices went up a dollar. FOR WHAT?! FOR WHAT?!
Is what I'd like to know. I can see raising your prices because you are now using Kobe beef. But, C'mon. Don't blame this on the price of gas too. I still like your garlic lime steak burrito, but you have to come down on your prices. Crunch the numbers. Do something.
author: Rafael L.

description:
I've only eaten here once and I really enjoyed my burrito. I had the special of the day that was on the board outside. It was lobster and steak. It was a lil' pricey but it was a good burrito. 

Minus one star for charging for chips and salsa. That should come with your order..... FREE of charge.

I agree, if I could choose no stars, I would. 

I am on the quest for the best fish taco in the financial district. Yes, an impressive feat because the financial district has notoriously bad food choices available, but also because well let's face it, this ain't the mission district. 

Joe's Taco Lounge in Mill Valley spoiled me with their fried fish taco with habenero mayo. Good God. 

So today I was craving a fish taco for lunch. I looked up a few places on line, called around and figured 360 was my best bet due to proximity to my office. 

I ordered the fish taco and it came with two tacos. If you could even call them that. They was the absolutely grossest things I have EVER eaten. I would have taken in back, which I have never done but I was starving and needed to be fortified for a meeting. The taco was filled with shredded lettuce (WTF???) and contained a liquidy mass of disgusting looking gray fish.  I only got through one and threw out the other. 

Plus, the staff is rude. And they don't have any limes. Yes, I am aware those are lemons, thank you.

As I sit here typing this my stomach is now churning and I have a feeling if I don't get some peptobismol or keyopectate soon, its going to be a bad bad bad afternoon. Good thing this office has a private toilet. 

EW. DONT GO HERE. YOU WILL REGRET IT!
author: Katie D.

description:
I'm going to have to be another person that is in the minority on this one. 360 has very good gourmet burritos that you really can't find in many other places. Garlic/Lime Burrito, Cajun Burrito, Teriyaki Burrito, plus burrito bowls and salads ... all with the same flavors. How can you go wrong with THAT?!?!? Plus they have steak, lamb, fish, chicken and veggie options. LAMB!!!

The chips aren't that great ... but ... I'm not really there for the chips. 

Plus, there is really hot Persian girl that hands me my food. 

Word.
author: Brandon L.

description: The food here tastes better the hungrier you are. I recommend going for the chicken and veggie fillings to be on the safe side. The steak is usually hit or miss...can be tender, can be tough and sinewy. I tend to add extra cheese, sour cream and guacamole to my order to improve on the flavor, but I don't like that I have to pay extra for it. Chips and salsa on the side are also very meager in portions. The one plus is the establishment's location within the Crocker Galleria -- an easy to miss center, and somewhat bleak due to the random and  unmainstream stores located within -- but a pleasant place to sit and have a meal...I love locations that feel spacious and bright. On good weather days I highly recommend taking your food up to the rooftop terrace seating area and enjoying it there.
author: Elaine W.

description: Confirmed with staff that both chicken and beef are Halal, although there is no sign anywhere. Had the steak quesadilla which was pretty good. Try the orange garlic sauce which is nice. This place is located inside the SF food court mall which is located on Post street near Montgomery.
author: Irfan R.

description:
Quick Service
Somewhat Fresh toppings... somewhat
Decent Food
Interesting Selections (Curry Burrito, Thai Burrito)

Overall, when I think of a burrito place... I want a good burrito... not a wrap from somewhere else in the world. Poor marketing... if you ask me. 

I think its a 2... but am willing to give it another try to see if my opinion improves.
author: Jordan Y.

description: I don't like to write bad reviews, but in this case I felt it was necessary. I've blacklisted this chain. Do not eat here. I've been to different locations of 3 times, and left extremely disappointed every time. Recently I got some nachos. Movie theater style perma-liquid american cheese, tasteless  guacamole of questionable freshness, and runny black beans. Worst part: it wasn't even cheap! There are so many cheaper, tastier, fresher, and more authentic Mexican restaurants in the city -- skip this one.
author: Jeremy F.

description:
I confess to being addicted to the 360 burrito with steak and chicken dressed in garlic-lime sauce. Just writing about it is making me drool and that doesn't happen very often. However, prices are on the high side. 

They offer fresh chips with every order but you have to ask for it. Salsa can be found on the right hand side of the registers.
author: S L.

description: This is not really a Burrito place but if you like wraps and salads it is a good place to go. They have a variety of salsa's including one that is sweet and spicy and really has more of an Asian flavor. I always get the gourmet burrito steak only with garlic lime sauce add guacamole. Make sure to use the frequent buyer card Crocker has.
author: Kelly O.

description:
I seem to be in the minority on this one. Their steak burritos are the best I've ever had.

Have been eating at 360 since they first opened in the Financial District about 10 years ago, and I now drive all the way from Berkeley to Alameda to get a fix, there not being an outlet any closer. The fresh steak, the lettuce and salsa on the burrito, the great sauce choices on the side....yum yum.

You can also sample 360 on the flyside at Oakland airport, just past security at the main terminal. Try their breakfast burrito sometime before you board an early morning flight!
author: Judy S.

description:
and yet, another birthday in my office today.... in the next few weeks i'm going to be on birthday overload. 

my roomies is next week and yet another friend has one the following week. will this madness ever end?

the perks of having an office birthday though is that we always get it catered. the special birthday person gets to pick the place of their choice. terra wanted 360 degree burritos because she's just cool like that.

i had never been to this place and was a bit surprised to see the menu.... its not your traditional burrito fare. true to its name, its all these weird versions (i.e. thai burritos, curry burritos, burritos with feta cheese. yes i said feta cheese)

i tried the lobster one..... yummm. pretty damn good. tons and tons of garlic sauce though. if fact everyone was commenting on the extreme amounts of spices, garlic and cilantro used in the burritos. can you say extreme amounts? 

immediately after eating all this garlic i felt an intense urge to have a long and sloppy make out session with someone. garlic flavored. it would've been hot.

instead i found one of those little pocket packs of listerine strips in my desk..... which had been sitting unopened forever. i had been saving it for an emergency. once everyone saw i had them it was mayhem! now i have none left  *sad face* and everyone in here smells like mint strips. gross.

that lobster sure was good, but i guess i'll have to stay away from 360 degree till i buy more pocket strips.
author: Michelle I.

description: I had high expectations given the three/four star reviews, but for six bucks, I expected a heftier burrito.  I've had better tasting ones for a dollar less.  To their credit, they offer up a variety of burritos, with plenty of fresh veggie ingredients and even tofu filling.  The staff was also pleasant.  You can only expect so much for a burrito in the FiDi.
author: Marsha Z.

description: It was good and hearty and I ate the whole thing!  Not authentic, but what do you expect downtown- we are not in the mission or in Mexico here, we are in union square.  So for the location it was great!  I got the chicken burrito in a spinach tortilla with a side of sour cream and hot sauce and was very pleased!  Full and pleased!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: I've been to this place almost 10 times now in less than 3 weeks and I have to say, they have some good stuff. I tried their cajun chicken burrito and it was GOOD. It couldn't get any better. The burrito was filling and they give nachos along with the burrito. I also tried their $5 lunch special with a burrito, drink and nachos. I loved it! I usually go there at lunchtime and its really full but it's definitely worth the 5 minute wait :)
author: On The G.

description: I've got it:  let's open a burrito shop catering to yuppie corporate drones in a hurry over their lunch hour who don't know La Taqueria from Del Taco:  "hot" salsa becomes "medium", "medium" becomes ketchup, and burritos are merely assembled from pre-cooked parts sitting in a steam tray and served lukewarm.  Genius!
author: Adam Z.

description: I didn't realize sour cream could be that liquidy! Not only that, but there was a ceasar salad in the middle of my veggie burrito, it immediately exploded with liquid the second I bit into it, and the whole thing just tasted like a crappy wrap. I didn't even finish it.
author: Johnny E.

description: Been several times, Vegi Super Burrito w/black beans was good. A little bland. I added a lot of salsa to spice it up. Today I decided to try the Curry Burrito. It was ok, but not great. I finished it because I was starved, not because I was in love with the flavor or taste. I think I'll stick to the standard burrito next time and just add salsa.
author: Alex T.

description:
I ate here yesterday when a friend of mine told me about this great burrito place. Now when someone tells me a burrito place is great, my immediate semi joke semi serious response is "so good my mexican friend's grandma would approve of it?" I get a.."well...it's not really that kind of burrito place..."

It was ash wednesday and being the semi serious catholic I am, I already had in mind that I was going to order a fish taco. However, after looking at their menu, I decided to be a little adventurous and order a tofu thai burrito.

When I ordered, the guy asked me "sour cream, cheese, guacamole?" I said yes because...well whats a burrito without these essential ingredients? It wasn't till later I realized that he charged for these extra essentials which is a downgrade for me and I was wondering why the burrito was almost 9 dollars. The burrito was good but definitely not worth that much.

Onto what I actually ordered, I actually enjoyed the tofu thai burrito. I thought the sauce was tasty without being too overwhelming (which led to me not really needing to use the 2..3...maybe 4 packets of orange sauce I swooped into my bag.) and it had a fairly diverse yet tasty combo of ingredients (I can't expand on whats inside aside from the standard ingredients because, well, I honestly don't remember and the website doesn't tell you. But I do remember tasting bean sprouts.)

My rating rationing:
The burrito was actually good.
The service was quick
They have free complimentary orange sauce packets. Though I can't write anything about it since I didn't use it in my burrito. 
The burrito was a fair size but it was big pricey for what I received. I can get a fatter burrito at chipotle for a better value AND they don't charge extra for sour cream and cheese. just guacamole. ha.
author: Krista Marie I.

description: I usually just get regular burritos - a steak, chicken or carnitas super burrito... but I went recently with a vegetarian friend and she was eating a curry with tofu and rice burrito, I thought it was so strange, weird and gross!  But boy-oh-boy was I wrong!!  I ate it and I am so addicted now... I actually got another co-worker at work craving them now. since i only eat half of it, I had her try the other half... ha ha!
author: kiko v.

description: This place used to taste a lot better. Either that or my taste buds got a lot better at identifying tasteless food. Came here recently for lunch and was so disappointed. I had the cajun chicken which had mushy, dry, overcooked chicken and no flavor to the burrito except a bit of spiciness. I rather go to Chipotle!
author: Linda C.

description: This place makes me feel like my $5 just fell through a hole in my pocket while a black belt ninja kicks me in the abdomen.  And who comes up with these awful burrito ideas?
author: Kurosh H.

description: This place isn't anything special. I mean, they do have international burritos and stuff, but that's about it. I got the breakfast burrito because it was the cheapest thing on their menu and they were advertising all over the Galleria. It tasted okay, but it wasn't wow. Somehow I see myself coming back though.
author: Alex Y.

description: 360 offers a wide variety of burritos.  I've never taken advantage of this.  I stick with the steak.  I'm not very much fun.  And I can be mean and cruel.  So don't cross me.  And don't forget to grab the free sauces on your way out.  Service has always been lightening fast and the food is fine.  Gotta say, though, I think I prefer McPotle.  Is that so wrong?
author: Daryl E.

description: There are many better burrito places in the city. This one just happens to be right by my office so I went to check it out. The burritos are a tad small. I went back and had the chicken tacos and they were good. Not my first choice but I've had much worse!
author: Derek O.

description:
what the fuck is a salad doing in my burrito? 

lettuce scattered throughout the damned thing made for an odd experience

they did, however, have large chunks of steak instead of the more ground up stuff, and guacamole was applied liberally

otherwise it was relatively okay, and up for the usual FiDi price hike

still, for a burrito significantly better you might as well go to baja fresh a few blocks down
author: Charles C.

description: My husband and I had luch there.  I ordered a prawn salad that came out very skimpy.  The tiny prawn looked pre-cooked frozen type.  My husband had a steak/chicken dry burrito that lacked flavor. He had to put extra salsa for moisture.  He also said the steak was too chewey.
author: Jennifer H.

description: We had this delivered for lunch today.  Pretty good - I had the Garlic Lime steak burrito - pretty tasty but not my favorite.
author: Dana C.

description: First of all you're not going to get a mexican burrito here. If that's what you seek, you definitely need to look elsewhere. My standby here is their gourmet burrito in a whole wheat tortilla. It has no rice or beans, filled with a plentiful amount of chicken and beef with romain lettuce, and much healthier for you than the 1200 calorie Chipotle burrito. Definitely get it with the garlic lime dressing. 610 calories, 39g protein, 70g carbs, 3g fat according to their website.
author: Clodel G.

description: Delicious! Stuffed burritos tasty enough you don't even need to add salsa. The only draw back to this joint is the lack of seating. Though it's within a very easy walk to St. Mary's Park for burritos on the grass. Superb, tasty and reasonably priced.
author: Josie Z.

description: I had avoided this place for a while because I usually just saw the $6.49 "gourmet" / "world" burritos when I glanced in. However, today I saw that the vegetarian (vegan even) burritos were significantly lower priced: $4.99 for "mixed vegetable" and $3.99 for just rice and beans. I got the former and was pretty surprised at how decent it was. Heavy on the rice, but it was good rice, so that's fine with me. Five bones plus tax for lunch in the financial district is actually pretty dang good. The only real complaint I had was the salsa - I opened the lid to find a perfectly solid gelatinous mass, comfortably defying gravity on one side of the container. It would not pour and I wasn't about to eat any salsa that I had to carve out of the container. Three stars in comparison to the rest of this neighborhood, but two overall.
author: neil o.

description: not spicy, no no no spice,  it is just another stand at a bad carny mall full of fake business all for thee business man power lunch and tourist.  But so it the plight of the finical district, and so is my plight when I forget to pack a lunch.
author: adams l.

description: Whatever it is this place serves, it definitely isn't a "burrito". I've tried a few of the "flavors" all of which were an exercise is over flavored meat slopped onto a tortilla and rushed to me.
author: Preston G.

description: Every time I eat one of these things, I marvel at how I was ever capable of finishing it!  Yet somehow, I still do.  And I'll tell you why: Because it's damn good, that's why!  OK, so maybe it's not "Authentic", but for the Financial District, I would say that it's pretty damn good.  I know I'm supposed to hate it, 'cause it's a chain & all that, but this very fact can be a virtue: a lot of my favorite taquerias in the Mission are total dives, and I have serious questions about their cleanliness & the quality/condition of their ingredients.  Because 360 is a chain, they are held to a different standard, and they HAVE to keep everything to a certain level of cleanliness & order (particularly if they want to maintain their audience of Financial District people).  Their ingredients are super fresh, and the place is CLEAN.  And it's still way better than a burrito you'd get from a real CHAIN chain like Del Taco or that other one on 2nd St (whose name I don't remember).  I actually like this 360 better than Chipotle or any of the other surrounding burrito spots.  Of course, I'm veg, so I can't speak for the burritos with meat.  But the Super Rice & Bean is awesome.  If only I could get the spicy salsa ALREADY IN the burrito, that would be great.  But they have it on the side, so I can't complain.  And the staff is always pleasant; always greeting you with a smile.  Never thought I'd be giving 4 stars to a chain, but for what it is, it's great, so I've got to give it up!
author: Eric H.

description: Personally i don't really like mexican food but because my husband likes burrito, i eat it once in a while to make him happy. However, i don't eat burrito in this place. I always order the salad with chicken, steak, tofu and shrimp. The price is reasonable and they give you plenty of salad. The salad is fresh, made to order and the thing that i like that they cook the meat when you order it so it is actually hot warm not cold meat. They are pretty generous in giving the meat so you feel full and satisfied unlike some other salad places that are so stingy with meat.
author: sofie W.

description:
Well, from the recent reviews, it's obvious that 360 Gourmet Burritos has fallen from the "faves list" of those who think they are young, beautiful, hip business professionals.  I go there often and have yet to eat a burrito that was not well prepared and delicious.  They have a creative way of taking a traditional Mexican dish and putting a California Twist on it that is new and refreshing.  The service?  Not bad, considering I go at lunch time and usually find a line going out the door.  The staff, who probably make little more than minimum wage and never seem to get a break, have never been rude to me.  I guess it's because I haven't been rude to them, first.  And I always say, "Thank you".  
For those who might think this post is from someone with connections to the place:  Forget it.  I don't know the owners.  I don't know anybody who works there.  I don't own any stock in the company.  I simply work in the neighborhood and think it's a great deal for lunch.
author: Raymond W.

description: service has always been great!. I always order the regular burrito and one time i actually ordered their special: chicken something. the rice AND black beans tasted kinda dry and well, tasteless. their gauc is usually good but for some reason, that one time, it was super salty and didnt taste fresh. oh yeah, i tried the quesadilla once and it was toooo cheesey. stick with their "gourmet" burrito.
author: Bren L.

description: closed down.   the only other location i know of is in livermore.  on 1st street.
author: jay c.

description: Very convenient to my work. The smoked tofu is awesome, and I'm not even a vegetarian!
author: Elle E.
